title: Three Simple Ways to Make Your Child a Multi-Millionaire
subtitle: Turn Small Earnings into Big Futures Through Strategic Investing
content:
Three Simple Ways to Make Your Child a Multi-Millionaire

I'm Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. Earn $3,000 a Year Helping Your Business

Pay your child $3,000 a year to help with your businessâ€”think social media, filing, or basic tasks that are age-appropriate. Open a custodial Roth IRA for them, and invest it in a growth ETF like Vanguard's VUG. If you do this from ages 10 to 18 and then never again, by age 65, they could have around $3.6 million, and it's 100% tax-free. They will have contributed just $27,000.

2. Earn $2,000 a Year Working for Themselves

Help them earn $2,000 a year through self-employment activities like babysitting, lawn mowing, or dog walking. Again, use the custodial Roth IRA and invest in a growth fund like VUG. If they do this from age 12 to 18 and then never again, by age 65, they'll have approximately $1.67 million, all tax-free. Their total contribution would be $14,000.

3. First W-2 Job at Age 16

If they earn $3,500 a year working for someone else, open the same custodial Roth IRA with those earnings. If they only do this for three summers, the $10,500 they contributed could turn into over $1 million by age 65.

Remember, earned income plus a custodial Roth IRA plus time equals millionaire status. If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. Each week, I'll send you over another money playbook that actually works.
